on@...> wrote:
>
> Thanks - honestly the idea is stolen from PMD.
> Its wha=
t they use to
> replace attributes (in Java 1.4) so you can supress individ=
ual
> warnings. I bet that you could get the code to the job there.

Are yo=
u referring to PMD - the source code analyzer?

This reference points to th=
e possible convergence of unit testing 
and source code analysis.  In a lim=
ited sense - this is the notion 
of Verification Facilitation - interrogati=
ng a code base through 
convergence of the two approaches. 

> I also wonde=
r if you've considered trying to some automated 
arguement
> checking? Test=
 that methods either accept interesting params: null,
> "", -1, Integer.MAX=
_VALUE, .... or throw the appropriate argument
> exception.
>

This is very=
 interesting - and the scope could go beyond simply 
accessor methods.  For=
 instance, the application chronicled 
in "TestUtil: By Example" contains a=
bout 5,000 methods (~3,000 are 
accessors).  It might be useful to have a l=
ist of which of those 
5,000 signatures, that include a parameter of type O=
bject, do not 
throw an exception for a null argument.  The list could be o=
rganized 
by accessor and non-accessor methods.

Is this the concept you ha=
d in mind?
 
> If you're interested I could flesh out the idea some more.

=
Absolutely.
